title: Khalistani-linked fugitive wanted by NIA among 8 Indian-origin men held by FBI
content: The FBI, in collaboration with local law enforcement, apprehended Pavittar Singh Batala, a fugitive linked to Babbar Khalsa International, in California. The arrest, part of 'Summer Heat' initiative, also led to the capture of seven others and the seizure of a significant cache of weapons and ammunition. Batala faces charges related to organized crime, with Indian agencies seeking his extradition.

title: Ahead of EAM's Beijing visit, China warns of 'thorn' in ties with India
content: Ahead of S Jaishankar's China visit and the Dalai Lama's 90th birthday, the Chinese embassy in New Delhi has asserted that the Dalai Lama's succession is an internal affair of China and a hindrance to China-India relations.

title: 'Op Baam just the beginning': Baloch leader after major attacks on Pak army
content: The Baloch National Movement (BNM) declared that Balochistan will never be part of Pakistan, coinciding with the launch of "Operation Baam," a series of coordinated attacks by the Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) targeting the Pakistan army across key districts.

title: 'India still sare jahan se accha': Shubhanshu Shukla in final message from ISS
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, echoing Rakesh Sharma's sentiment from space 41 years prior, declared India "better than the whole world" from the International Space Station during the Axiom-4 farewell ceremony. Shukla highlighted India's ambition and confidence, expressing gratitude to ISRO, Axiom Space, NASA, and SpaceX for the mission.

title: Top engineer quits Elon Musk’s AI firm: Joins OpenAI; says ‘Jensen Huang was right…’
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: The chip race: US opens tech gates for China; should Indian firms worry?
content: Experts caution India to bolster its chip design capabilities amid rising competition from China, spurred by the US easing EDA software export restrictions. This shift intensifies the global race for semiconductor market share, urging India to accelerate R&D, skill development, and strategic investments to secure its position in the industry. The focus should be on innovation and addressing complex problems.

title: IND vs ENG: 60 minutes of hell! When Siraj unleashed fury on Bazballers at Lord's
content: Mohammed Siraj on Sunday bowled a breathtaking spell at Lord’s, rattling England’s top order with pace, bounce, and on-the-face aggression. In a 60-minute burst of hostility, the open-chested predator became the face of India’s charge, silencing the Bazballers with his venomous precision.

title: Microsoft job cuts: Encourages employees after laying off 15,000
content: Microsoft is urging its remaining workforce to enhance their AI skills after significant layoffs impacting over 15,000 employees this year. The company is integrating AI usage into performance reviews and shifting its sales strategy towards technically proficient "solutions engineers." This move comes amidst substantial AI investments and a company-wide push for Copilot adoption.

title: Ramayana in Karachi: Pakistani group making waves with adaptation of Hindu epic
content: A Pakistani theatre group, "Mauj," has earned acclaim for its adaptation of the "Ramayana" in Karachi, Sindh. The production, enhanced by AI technology, was staged at the Karachi Arts Council. Director Yoheshwar Karera expressed confidence in presenting the epic, emphasizing the positive reception and the tolerance of Pakistani society, while reviewers lauded the authentic storytelling and overall presentation.

title: Govt breaks silence on Chinese engineers leaving iPhone maker Foxconn’s plant
content: The Indian government is closely watching the departure of Chinese engineers from Foxconn, a major iPhone supplier, but believes Apple has solutions to maintain production. Despite concerns about potential disruptions to iPhone 17 production, Apple is increasing iPhone production in India, aiming for 60 million units this year, with eased component sourcing from China and government support through visa facilitation.

title: Watch: Stokes floored by brutal Siraj delivery; ECB shares cheeky video
content: Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell rattled England in the third Test at Lord's, highlighted by a painful blow to captain Ben Stokes. Siraj's delivery struck Stokes in a sensitive area, leaving him sprawled on the pitch. India's dominant bowling display saw England struggling at 98/4, with Siraj claiming key wickets and India pushing for a series lead.

title: IND vs ENG: From Cod to Curry - Lord’s Day 4 players' menu steals the spotlight
content: Lord's Cricket Ground once again impressed on Day 4 of the third Test between India and England by revealing its Players' Dining Room menu. The spread featured a diverse range of options, from British classics like chicken and wild mushroom lasagne to Indian-inspired curries such as chicken tikka and paneer korma.

title: 'Friendship is done': Swift unlikely to forgive Blake Lively after betrayal
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship faces trouble. Sources say they are not in contact. This follows Lively's connection to Justin Baldoni's legal issues. Lively's image suffered, straining the bond. Swift is now focused on Travis Kelce. Lively seeks new high-profile connections. The friendship may be over. Both are moving on with their careers and relationships.

title: Penguins quash Crosby trade rumors, vow to keep their captain
content: Amidst swirling trade rumors linking Sidney Crosby to teams like the Colorado Avalanche and Montreal Canadiens, the Pittsburgh Penguins have firmly stated their captain will not be traded. Despite speculation fueled by the Penguins' current standing and comments from some insiders, Crosby's agent and close friend have refuted the claims.

title: Seth Rollins hurt in shocking accident at WWE Saturday night’s main event
content: Seth Rollins sustained a legitimate knee injury during a match against LA Knight at Saturday Night’s Main Event, potentially halting his momentum. The incident occurred while Rollins attempted a Moonsault, landing awkwardly after Knight moved. The match was cut short, with Knight picking up the win. Rollins, who has a history of knee issues, was assisted backstage.

title: 'Should I speak in Marathi or Hindi?': RS nominee Nikam recalls call with PM
content: Ujjwal Nikam, renowned special public prosecutor, expressed gratitude for his Rajya Sabha nomination, recounting a personal call from PM Modi. The Prime Minister, after jokingly asking whether to converse in Hindi or Marathi, spoke in Marathi to convey the President's decision.

title: Radhika Yadav murder: Village taunts over daughter's reels fuelled father's rage
content: Radhika Yadav's pursuit of a coaching career and social media presence reportedly fueled tensions with her father, Deepak, who had invested heavily in her tennis aspirations. Villagers' comments on her online activity allegedly exacerbated Deepak's disapproval, leading to frequent arguments.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Arrogance' - Sangakkara slams Brook after reckless dismissal
content: Harry Brook's aggressive batting backfired at Lord's, leading to criticism from Kumar Sangakkara, who termed his dismissal as "arrogance." Brook's attempted sweep against Akash Deep resulted in his wicket, contributing to England's shaky position at 98/4. Earlier, Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell dismantled Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope, shifting momentum towards India as they aim for a series lead.

title: 'Tried to kill me': Mob attacks ex-Cong leader's office; gunman fires in air
content: Suspended Congress MLC Teenmaar Mallanna alleges an assassination attempt orchestrated by Telangana Jagruthi members at BRS MLC K Kavitha's instigation, following his remarks about her. Mallanna's security guard fired in self-defense as protesters stormed his office, prompting a police complaint.

title: 'Height to hai hi nahi': How Siraj convinced Gill for DRS - WATCH
content: Mohammed Siraj's confidence and fiery spells were instrumental on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's. His conviction led to a successful DRS review, dismissing Ollie Pope after trapping him plumb in front. Earlier, Siraj had removed Ben Duckett, fueled by lingering tension from the previous day, as India seized momentum.

title: Gaza death toll passes 58,000; ceasefire talks drag on
content: The Palestinian death toll in Gaza has surpassed 58,000 since the war's onset 21 months ago, with a significant number being women and children. Recent Israeli airstrikes resulted in at least 19 fatalities, including six children at a water collection point, amidst stalled ceasefire negotiations.

title: 'We had Dhoni but if Pant continues to play like this .... ': Ex-India cricketer
content: Manoj Tiwari lauded Rishabh Pant's unique style, suggesting he could become history's greatest wicketkeeper if he maintains it. Pant's impressive performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, with 416 runs, underscores his potential. Tiwari also praised Shubman Gill's form and Jasprit Bumrah's impactful return, highlighting their crucial roles in the Indian team's success.

title: US-EU tariff tensions: EU extends suspension of countermeasures to August
content: Ursula von der Leyen announced the EU will extend the suspension of retaliatory tariffs on US steel and aluminum until early August, amidst ongoing negotiations to avert broader 30% duties threatened by the US.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Pant should share match fees with Jurel' - Ex-India keeper makes hilarious remark
content: During the India versus England Test at Lord's, Dhruv Jurel substituted for an injured Rishabh Pant. Jurel's wicket-keeping skills drew attention. Dinesh Karthik jokingly suggested Pant should share his match fees with Jurel. India scored 387, with KL Rahul's century and Pant's fifty. Fans await updates on Pant's injury. The match remains tightly contested.

title: Language row: Auto driver slapped by Uddhav Sena workers over 'anti-Marathi' remark
content: A video showing Shiv Sena (UBT) workers assaulting an auto-rickshaw driver in Palghar for allegedly insulting the Marathi language and icons has gone viral. The driver was forced to apologize publicly. The incident follows a similar action by MNS workers against a food stall owner for not speaking Marathi, highlighting tensions over language use in Maharashtra.

title: AI171 crash report: ICPA slams 'pilot suicide theory'
content: Following the preliminary report on the AI 171 incident, the India Commercial Pilots' Association (ICPA) has strongly condemned the baseless rumors of pilot suicide. The ICPA emphasizes the rigorous screening and training pilots undergo, denouncing the insinuation as unethical and insensitive. They urge respect for the ongoing investigation and support for the crew, who acted responsibly under difficult circumstances.

title: Watch: Women clash on bus over mobile charger slot
content: A dispute over a mobile charging point on a bus in Kanpur escalated into a physical fight between two women, Parul Singh and Renu Vishwakarma. The altercation prompted police intervention, with an officer chasing the bus to restore order. Ultimately, both women were fined for disturbing the peace after the incident near the Armapur canal.

title: Arizona resident dies from pneumonic plague; know about the disease
content: A resident of Northern Arizona's Coconino County succumbed to pneumonic plague, marking the first such death since 2007. Health officials confirmed the rare but deadly lung infection, caused by Yersinia pestis, can spread through respiratory droplets. Symptoms include fever, cough, and chest pain, with rapid deterioration possible.

title: Watch: Siraj gives Duckett a fiery send-off as tensions boil over at Lord’s
content: Mohammed Siraj ignited Day 4 of the Lord's Test by dismissing Ben Duckett, celebrating aggressively in response to simmering tensions between India and England. This followed Zak Crawley's time-wasting tactics on Day 3, which angered Shubman Gill and the Indian team. Siraj's fiery celebration underscored India's renewed aggression and determination to capitalize on Duckett's early dismissal.

title: 'Sootra ko hum mootra samajhte hain', Tejashwi mocks 'illegal voters' claim
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav dismissed reports of illegal migrants from Bangladesh, Nepal, and Myanmar being registered as voters in Bihar, questioning the credibility of the sources. He accused the BJP-led NDA of being responsible for any dubious names on voter lists, calling the Election Commission's special intensive revision (SIR) an "eyewash.

title: IND vs ENG: 'I said 100 before lunch ...': Rahul breaks silence on Pant run-out
content: KL Rahul's century at Lord's was overshadowed by Rishabh Pant's unfortunate run-out, which Rahul admitted was partly due to his push for the milestone before lunch. Their 141-run partnership showcased contrasting styles, with Rahul's steady approach complementing Pant's aggressive flair. Despite the setback, Rahul praised Pant's solid performance and expressed regret over the missed opportunity for both to excel.

title: 'I'd play rugby with that': Broad ridicules Dukes ball as shape controversy erupts
content: Stuart Broad has ignited a debate regarding the quality of the Dukes ball used in the India vs England Test series, expressing his dissatisfaction with the rejected balls from the Lord's Test. He criticized the balls for losing shape quickly, rendering them ineffective for both bowlers and batters, impacting the game's overall quality and playing conditions.

title: Student sets self ablaze over 'harassment': Odisha govt to bear medical expenses
content: In Odisha, a college student's self-immolation after alleged ignored sexual harassment complaints prompted swift action. The state government pledged to cover medical expenses and formed a high-level committee for investigation. The accused HoD and Principal have been suspended, and the accused teacher is now in police custody, with initial evidence supporting the student's claims.

title: 'Rs 3 lakh to Rs 11 lakh': Protest in Mumbai after BJP MLA offers bounty on priests
content: Thousands of Christians protested in Mumbai against BJP MLA Gopichand Padalkar's alleged threats inciting violence against those involved in religious conversions. The community demands Padalkar's resignation and an FIR, while also expressing concern over a proposed anti-conversion law. Demonstrations occurred statewide, with leaders calling for protection and action against hate speech.

title: Shukla returns from ISS on Tuesday; mother prepares 'grand welcome'
content: India eagerly awaits the return of its first astronaut, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, from the International Space Station. His Dragon spacecraft is set to undock on Monday, with a Pacific Ocean splashdown expected Tuesday. Shukla's family in Lucknow is preparing a grand welcome, with his mother planning his favorite home-cooked meals.

title: Bloodstained car, no trace of owner: Intel cop missing for 4 days; search operation on
content: A Punjab Police constable from the state intelligence department, Satinder Singh, has been missing since Tuesday night, prompting a large-scale search operation. His car was found near Bhanra village in Patiala, bearing bloodstains, raising concerns about his safety.

title: AI171 crash: At what stage did engines lose thrust? Pilots flag ambiguities
content: Pilots express concerns and skepticism regarding the AAIB report on the AI-171 incident, questioning the timing of engine shutdowns and the failure of the emergency locator transmitter. They highlight ambiguities in the report, the lack of transparency in the investigation, and the exclusion of experienced pilots from the investigation team.

title: Bihar SIR: Nepalese, Bangladeshis found in voter list; names to be excluded from final list
content: Election Commission officials in Bihar have identified numerous individuals from Nepal, Bangladesh, and Myanmar during voter list revisions. This verification process aims to exclude illegal migrants from the electoral roll, with citizenship status checks beginning in August.

title: 'Finger pointing and ... ': KP on Shubman Gill-Zak Crawley drama at Lord's
content: Tensions flared during the final moments of Day 3 in the India-England Test at Lord's, with Jasprit Bumrah and Zak Crawley at the center of a heated exchange. Shubman Gill and other Indian players engaged in verbal sparring with Crawley, prompting intervention from Ben Duckett. Kevin Pietersen supported the aggression, adding spice to the already intense series.

title: Kanwar Yatra: SC to hear plea challenging UP's directive to display QR
content: The Supreme Court is scheduled to review a petition on July 15 challenging the Uttar Pradesh government's directive for QR code displays at businesses along the 'kanwar' path, revealing owner identities. Academic Apoorvanand Jha and others filed the public interest litigation, alleging discriminatory profiling. The court had previously suspended similar orders from BJP-led states, citing privacy concerns for shop owners.

title: Browns' Judkins facing domestic violence charge
content: Cleveland Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins was arrested on a domestic violence and battery charge in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, on Saturday, according to the Fort Lauderdale Police Department and Broward County arrest records.

title: Sources: Anthony bought out, looks to join Bucks
content: Cole Anthony agreed to a contract buyout with the Memphis Grizzlies, and the 25-year-old guard plans to sign with the Milwaukee Bucks after he clears waivers, sources told ESPN on Saturday night.

title: Sharpe, 3-time Pro Bowl LT for Cardinals, dies
content: Longtime Cardinals left tackle Luis Sharpe, a three-time Pro Bowler who spent his entire 13-year NFL career with the franchise, has died at age 65.

title: Messi extends historic streak with 2 more goals
content: Lionel Messi extended his MLS-record streak of multigoal games as he scored twice in Inter Miami's win over Nashville.

title: Kim wins Evian in playoff for 1st LPGA major title
content: Grace Kim delivered one stunning shot after another Sunday in the Evian Championship to win her first major title.

title: Stevenson keeps belt with decision win vs. Zepeda
content: Shakur Stevenson couldn't score a knockout blow against William Zepeda but put together a boxing clinic to retain his WBC lightweight title with a unanimous decision Saturday night in Queens, N.Y.

title: FIFA, players agree to mandatory rest periods
content: Player unions secured an apparent victory in their battle for mandatory rest periods after a meeting in New York with FIFA president Gianni Infantino.

title: MLB mock draft 3.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first two rounds
content: The MLB draft is Sunday! And this year, the drama starts with the Washington Nationals at the No. 1 pick.

title: Who are the NFL's best offensive tackles? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Who are the best offensive tackles in the NFL? We asked execs, coaches and scouts to rank their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: Remembering Arthur Ashe's historic 1975 Wimbledon title
content: Stan Smith, Richard Evans and Chris Eubanks reflect on the 50th anniversary of Arthur Ashe's Wimbledon victory.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: How Chelsea, PSG compare; who will win?
content: One of Chelsea or PSG will win the first expanded Club World Cup on Sunday, so how do they match up ahead of the final?

title: The unstoppable power of Jim Abbott's legacy
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Why LeBron and the Lakers are stuck in limbo
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: Gyökeres warned with fines after going on strike
content: Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas has insisted that Viktor Gyökeres will face fines after he went on strike Saturday, refusing to report to the club's preseason training.

title: Liverpool remember Jota in emotional first friendly
content: Liverpool and Preston North End players, staff and supporters paid tribute to Diogo Jota during their preseason friendly on Sunday.

title: Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC
content: FIFA President Gianni Infantino said stadiums with roofs will be used to ease concerns over severe weather at the 2026 Men's World Cup.

title: Not done yet: Cazorla, 40, inks new Oviedo deal
content: Santi Cazorla will be back in LaLiga next season after signing a new contract with newly promoted Real Oviedo.

title: LaLiga boss rejects Madrid plea to extend break
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas rejected Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois' plea to postpone the team's 2025-26 league opener to give players time to rest following the Club World Cup.

title: Louis van Gaal 'no longer bothered by cancer'
content: Louis van Gaal has said he is "no longer bothered by cancer" and is keen for a return to the higher levels of the game.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Rashford nears Man United exit as Barcelona lay out terms
content: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is increasingly likely to join Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Sweden demolish Germany, Poland make history
content: Sweden topped Group C with a commanding win over Germany. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: ‘One pinch at a time’: ICMR flags high salt intake in India as major health risk
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . toi World Desk is a dedicated team of journalists and writers who work tirelessly to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world .

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Vanished after call: What happened to Sneha Debnath? Tripura teen goes missing in Delhi
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: ‘Strong so far’: IMF on Pakistan’s reforms; first review of $7 billion loan approved
content: 'dhadak 2' star Tripti Dimri's most stunning no-makeup looks 9 quotes that feel like poetry for the soul 10 things to know before getting Lovebirds as pets 9 interesting facts about snake plant 10 stunning flowers that bloom during monsoon Meet the titans: The world's 10 biggest animals by size In pics: Karthik Surya and Varsha's dreamy wedding photos .

title: Phils rip MLB for Miz All-Star pick: 'What a joke'
content: multiple Phillies players ripped Major League Baseball's decision to add Jacob Misiorowski to the national league All-Star roster . the Brewers rookie has made just five starts for Milwaukee . he will replace Cubs pitcher Matthew Boyd on the NL roster, citing his lack of experience in the majors .

title: Mumbai Man With Upset Stomach Falls To Death From 18th Floor While Defecating
content: A 52-year-old man with an upset stomach died after falling from the 18th floor of a building here on Sunday while defecating from the edge of a shaft, an official said.

title: Rain Lashes Parts Of Delhi, Weather Office Issues Red Alert
content: Parts of the city were lashed by rain on Sunday evening, bringing relief from the humid weather. The weather department has issued a red alert for more showers over the next few hours and throughout Monday.

title: Bangladesh Trying To Sweeten Ties? Yunus Sends Mangoes To PM Modi
content: Professor Muhammad Yunus, the head of Bangladesh's interim government, has initiated 'mango diplomacy' with India, weeks after the Foreign Ministry said New Delhi was willing to discuss all issues with Dhaka in a "conducive" environment.

title: "Even Today, Bharat LooksSaare Jahan Se Accha": Shux At His Space Farewell
content: India looks full of ambition, fearless, confident and full of pride from space, astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla said on Sunday.

title: Lawyer Shot Dead In Patna, 3rd Murder In Full Public View In A Week
content: A lawyer was shot dead on a road in full public view just 300 metres away from a police station in Bihar's capital Patna. This was the third brazen high-profile murder case in a week in the state where the assembly election is just months away.

title: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi Alleges "Horse Trading" Within Congress In Karnataka
content: With a Congress MLA claiming that the BJP was planning to topple the government in Karnataka and has prepared a list to target 55 legislators through central agencies, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Sunday hit back.

title: "It's Been 6 Days": Missing 19-Year-Old's Family Alleges Police Inaction
content: Najeeb Ahmed, a 27-year-old student at Jawaharlal Nehru University in Delhi, went missing in 2016. He has not been found till date. Now, Sneha Debnath, a 19-year-old student of Delhi University, has been missing for six days.

title: Children Fetching Water Among 43 Killed By Israeli Strikes In Gaza Amid Truce Talks Deadlock
content: At least 10 people, including eight children, were killed by an Israeli missile in central Gaza, while they were waiting in a queue at a water distribution point, emergency service officials said.

title: Manipur Insurgent Groups Modifying Looted Weapons Into Snipers Rifles
content: Manipur's ethnic insurgent groups from both the Meitei and Kuki communities are modifying weapons, many of them looted from police armouries in 2023, and converting them into makeshift sniper rifles

title: "Feel Like Failure": Missing Delhi University Student's Family Finds A Note
content: The disappearance of a 19-year-old Delhi University student, whose last known location was the Signature Bridge, has put the spotlight on the gaps in CCTV coverage of the national capital's streets

title: Man Beats 6-Year-Old Son To Death In Hotel Room In Bihar: Cops
content: A man allegedly killed his six-year-old son by throwing him on the floor of a hotel room near Patna railway station, police said on Sunday.

title: Accident Or Intentional? Mystery Of Glass Pieces On Delhi Kanwar Yatra Route
content: A day after pieces of broken glass were found strewn on a 1-km stretch of a road used by those walking barefoot in the Kanwar Yatra in east Delhi's Dilshad Garden, the police said the incident is linked to an e-rickshaw carrying glass panels.

title: Railways To Install CCTV Cameras Near Doors In All 74,000 Coaches For Safety
content: In a mega drive to enhance passenger safety, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has approved the installation of CCTV cameras in the common movement area near the doors in all 74,000 coaches, an official said on Sunday.

title: "Won't Spare Anyone": Brother Of Odisha Student Who's Fighting For Her Life
content: A day after a woman student from Odisha set herself on fire over inaction on her complaint of sex harassment against a professor, her brother told NDTV he "will go to any length" to ensure she gets justice.

title: Plea Against UP's QR Code Order For Eateries Along Kanwar Route In Top Court
content: The Supreme Court will hear a plea on July 15 challenging the Uttar Pradesh government's directive mandating the display of QR codes on all eateries along the 'kanwar' route, which reveal the names and identities of the owners.

title: Tensions In Madhya Pradesh's Harda As Cops Use Tear Gas On Protesters
content: Violence broke out in Harda, Madhya Pradesh, as police fired tear gas shells and used water cannons to disperse protesters from the Karni Sena Parivar, who were demanding action in a fraud case involving one of their members.

title: Tipra Motha Chief Demands 'Bihar Model' Electoral Rolls Revision In Tripura
content: Tipra Motha supremo Pradyot Kishore Manikya Debbarma on Sunday called for a 'Bihar model' revision of electoral rolls in Tripura ahead of Assembly elections in 2028.

title: Hindu Trader Lynched In Bangladesh, Attackers Dance On His Body
content: At least seven people have been arrested, and a nationwide combing operation was launched in Bangladesh on Sunday in connection with the killing of a scrap trader here, Home Affairs Adviser Lieutenant General (retd) Jahangir Alam Chowdhury said.

title: "Part Of Our Culture": Kerala Governor Backs 'Guru Puja' Amid Row
content: Kerala Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar on Sunday strongly defended the practice of 'guru puja' observed by a section of people, saying that "offering flowers at the feet of teachers is part of Indian culture".

title: Biggest Piece Of Mars On Earth Is Up For Auction In New York. All About It
content: The meteorite weighs over 25 kg and is 15 inches wide and is about 70 per cent bigger than any other piece of Mars ever found on Earth.

title: Draft tracker live updates: Order, results, analysis for every first-round pick
content: the 2025 MLB draft begins at 6 p.m. ET on ESPN . will the nationals opt for a high school star infielder Ethan Holliday? who will be the biggest steals -- and stretches -- of day 1?

title: Shakur Stevenson showed that the fight in him is second to none
content: Shakur Stevenson beats William Zepeda to retain his WBC lightweight title . he was promoted to the co-main event of Ring Magazine 3 by Turki Alalshikh . the chairman of Saudi Arabia's general entertainment authority was elevated to the main event .

title: 🎵 Drake reveals SGA tattoo, covers up LeBron
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander appears to be taking leBron James ' spot, but not on the court . he previously had a tattoo of the Los Angeles Lakers superstar's St. Vincent/St. Mary's jersey on the outside of his left arm with the no. 23 .

title: Katie Taylor fought the right fight at the right time against Amanda Serrano
content: women's boxing may not have the stage it had on Netflix in front of millions of viewers . she fought serrano's fight for the first 20 rounds of their trilogy . her coach and promoter advised her the first two times to not make the fights more difficult .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at TE, RB and Edge
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . we'll collect those names here as the top-10 for each position is revealed . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: The 30 players you need to pay attention to in summer league, from Atlanta to Washington
content: the 11-day tournament begins Thursday and runs through July 20 . the event will be headlined by the fresh faces of the 2025 draft class . top 2025 picks Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper and VJ Edgecombe will all be in action .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Kolkata police constitute SIT to probe into rape of women by student on IIM-C campus
content: A 26-year-old student has been booked and arrested based on a complaint by a mental health counsellor of rape on the campus. The police have sought the footage of CCTV inside the IIM-C premises

title: Micro-industries will be set up in each Assembly constituency for economic empowerment of women: Deputy CM Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka
content: Criticises BRS for abandoning interest-free loans for women, which were introduced by the successive Congress governments in the past; says the govt. has distributed interest-free loans worth ₹21,600 crore in the form of cheques to women’s SHGs in the first year itself

title: Ramesh Chennithala alleges massive irregularities in Anert solar projects, demands audit and probe by Assembly panel
content: The Congress leader cites instances where price differences of as much as 50% have occurred in the implementation of solar power projects of comparable capacity through different private firms.

title: Andhra Pradesh Energy Minister Gottipati Ravi Kumar rules out hike in power tariffs
content: Accusing the previous YSRCP government of failing to generate a single megawatt during its term, the Minister says that the NDA dispensation is focused on promoting large-scale green energy projects, particularly in the Rayalaseema region

title: Chouhan urges States to act against sale of fake fertilizers
content: Union Agriculture Minister calls for crackdown, seeks State-level monitoring and awareness campaigns to protect farmers’ interests

title: New bus terminus at Panjapur will become operational from July 16, says Minister
content: Tender for operation and maintenance of the terminus has been finalised and the chosen company will pay ₹50 lakh a year to the Corporation and get the right to collect rent from shops and entry fee from bus operators

title: Residents raise alarm over neglected PHC and PWD quarters in Jeevan Bima Nagar
content: Broken furniture, bags of cement, and abandoned vehicles clutter the premises of PHC and PWD quarters

title: 14 held in EAGLE decoy operation in Gachibowli
content: One of the customers came with his wife and four-year-old son. In another case, a couple who attempted to buy marijuana tested positive.

title: Raj Bhavan, Kerala government set for another face-off over foot worship at schools
content: Governor says ‘gurupuja’ is an integral part of Indian society and if such practices are set aside, the very existence of society will be affected. Education Minister Sivankutty says directives are being issued to all school authorities that no student in any school in Kerala should be made to wash the feet of teachers or anyone else

title: Government ready to clear doubts regarding revised timing in high schools: V. Sivankutty
content: Current objections against time revision were suspicious given that similar revisions in the past were not met with protests or disputes, says Minister

title: Monsoon treks near Visakhapatnam: Explore scenic Eastern Ghats trails
content: Monsoon treks near Visakhapatnam lead explorers into remote terrains shaped by Nature and guided by indigenous knowledge

title: Tirupati MLA lauds services of Reach Global Foundation
content: Appealing to everyone to help the poor under the P4 programme, District Collector S. Venkateswar announces that he has adopted five families from Nakkala Colony

title: Bihari migrants in Bengaluru are in dilemma over SIR
content: Many said travelling back home to submit documents for Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls is not practical at this point in time

title: A.P. Space Policy aims at attracting investments of ₹25,000 crore in next 10 years
content: Leveraging on Central government’s National Space Programme, the State government intends to create an inclusive ecosystem for space sector participants, including start-ups, large enterprises, academic institutions, and global investors

title: India joins bilateral military exercise in Australia
content: Talisman Sabre exercise, now in its 11th iteration, brings together more than 35,000 military personnel from 19 nations

title: Youth Congress locks horns with veteran Congress leader P.J. Kurien
content: Kurien says Youth Congress leaders are seen only on television and are absent from ground-level struggles, contrasting them with SFI members who align with ‘disaffected youth.’ The comments draw strong reactions from Youth Congress State president and other leaders

title: Body shaming, forcing liquor and drugs, online ragging made punishable in Kerala draft anti-ragging bill
content: Kerala Prohibition of Ragging (Amendment) Bill, has also brought “any form of ragging committed through the internet or in any digital mode” under the ambit of the criminal act of ragging for which severe punishment has been prescribed.

title: Assam CM sniffs conspiracy behind landless people moving to areas dominated by ‘Hindus or Assamese Muslims’
content: The BJP-led government has attracted flak from Opposition parties for evicting Muslims with their roots in present-day Bangladesh from reserve forests and wetlands

title: Godavari floods affect over 3,000 people in Eluru district, relief camps set up with food, medical aid
content: District Collector directs officials to remain stationed at the camps and ensure safety in the villages until the waters recede

title: Collector slaps student during exam in MP's Bhind; says his 'strictness' busted mass copying racket
content: Bhind Collector slaps student in exam centre, exposing mass copying racket; sparks controversy and demands for inquiry

title: Nitish Kumar promises jobs, employment for one crore people in five years
content: In a social media post, the Bihar Chief Minister claimed that between 2005 and 2020, over eight lakh youth in the State were provided with government jobs

title: Ministry of Textiles engages experts to survey Uppada Jamdani saree weaving, aims to support handloom weavers in Andhra Pradesh
content: WSC-Chennai to assess challenges in the GI-registered craft; ₹15 crore aid proposed under NHDP for design revival, market access, and welfare of fisherfolk weavers, says Kakinada MP

title: Data bank of unused govt. land in Kozhikode to be prepared for LIFE Mission
content: Private landholders are also encouraged to cooperate with the scheme under the ‘Manassode Ithiri Mannu’ campaign in Kozhikode district

title: Tejashwi seeks to puncture ECI's claims on progress in Bihar SIR
content: We would like to know from the EC how many such migrants have been covered under the exercise, questions Leader of Opposition in State Assembly Tejashwi Yadav

title: An honour for Kerala too, says Sadanandan
content: The BJP leader who was nominated to Rajya Sabha says BJP Central leadership has always bestowed “special attention” on Kerala regardless of its electoral success here

title: Minister hails A.P. for winning 10 ODOP awards
content: While seven were for handlooms and handicraft products, two were in the agriculture sector, and one in the inter-state category

title: Heavy transport vehicles to be diverted to Panjapur truck terminal in Tiruchi
content: The Tiruchi Corporation has requested the police to enforce diversions and coordinate with transport operators to ensure the effective use of the new terminal

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu leading a high-level team to Singapore from July 26
content: It will explore possibilities of collaboration and learning in areas such as urban planning, city beautification, gardening, ports, and other logistics infra

title: Judiciary must perform role of catalyst for LGBTQIA+ rights: Former SC judge Sanjay Kishan Kaul
content: Justice (retd) Kaul said that anti-discrimination law was more crucial in today’s age, where access to capital was the requisite for access to capital.

title: Film producer Balaga Prakash alleges harassment by revenue officials over land deal
content: He seeks intervention from National Commission for Scheduled Castes in the issue; Tekkali RDO says he is acting as per rules

title: J&K L-G scheme for militancy-affected families: What about those whose kin were killed by security forces? ask Farooquis
content: L-G Sinha promises justice and jobs to militancy-affected families, raising questions over fairness of new initiative

title: Tipplers can soon return used liquor bottles to Bevco’s bottle bins
content: The pilot project will be launched in Thiruvananthapuram city and Kannur rural. In the first phase, only plastic bottles, which comprise almost 75% of the liquor bottles sold by Bevco, will be collected. Collection of glass will be in later phases.

title: Seamless service and zero incidents: Solapur Railway Division’s remarkable handling of Ashadhi Fair pilgrims
content: Central Railway’s Solapur Division facilitated the travel of over 2 lakh pilgrims during the Ashadhi Fair in Pandharpur, Maharashtra, without a single incident

title: Tripura girl goes missing in Delhi, CM Saha instructs police to take appropriate action
content: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha gave necessary instructions to the police to take immediate and appropriate action on the matter.

title: Ex-BJP functionary among 3 shot dead in Bihar in two days
content: Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav slams the State Government over poor law and order and calls both the BJP Deputy Chief Ministers “useless”

title: Seventh edition of Huddle Global Start-up festival to be held in Kovalam in December
content: The conclave this year is set to draw thousands of participants representing over 15 countries, promising a bigger global gathering that celebrates start-up culture

title: On centenary year, Kakori train action to be celebrated in grand manner in Lucknow: Rajnath Singh
content: My effort will be to celebrate the centenary year of the Kakori incident in a grand manner in the city as well as other places, says Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

title: New butterfly species, Zographetus mathewi, discovered in Western Ghats
content: Zographetus mathewi is part of the Zographetus satwa species-group, characterised by unique features such as wing venation patterns and secondary sexual traits, including swollen forewing veins in males

title: From hotel cancellation to loss of baggage, Ahmedabad air crash victims opted for array of insurance
content: The incident has triggered claims under various insurance categories like travel, personal accident, and life insurance, including those from Kisan Credit Card holders

title: Power struggle escalates at Kerala University: V-C seeks control over file movement
content: Vice-Chancellor issues a directive to senior university officials, including Joint Registrar, not to process or forward any documents signed by Registrar

title: Election Commission of India activates field machinery for possible pan-India voter list revision from next month
content: Election Commission of India prepares for nationwide intensive review of electoral rolls to remove illegal foreign migrants, starting with Bihar

title: Accessing Jarawa one of the oldest surviving hunter-gather tribes for census will not be tough: Experts
content: The Government has formally announced that the 16th Census of India will take place in two phases, with the reference dates set as March 1, 2027, for most of the country and October 1, 2026

title: Three boys drown in pond in Ranipet
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the boys went to the pond to take bath despite no knowledge of swimming

title: Seized weapons show Manipur insurgent groups modifying some looted arms into sniper rifles
content: Officials say the weapons have been converted into makeshift sniper rifles to target opposing communities
